trans-unit.source: Provides an object list adapter for the mobile XHTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter> class can be used by mobile control developers to display an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> control on new devices or for new markup standards.
For more information, see [Control and Adapter Interaction](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/c330dabc-7e28-40bc-b777-101a5c6fa982).
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the user should be returned to the list view.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.BackToList> field, which is the value "__back", is used by mobile control developers.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref>.
Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI) if device templates are defined.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.CreateTemplatedUI%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.CreateTemplatedUI%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method of the corresponding control adapter, which in turn can either call back the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.CreateTemplatedItemsList%2A> method or the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.CreateTemplatedItemDetails%2A> method for the control, or create its own device-specific templated UI.
`true` to bind the templated UI to the underlying <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns `true` if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific.

If the control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> method and receives a postback event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter is called.

If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter.
This method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event.
It returns `false` by default.
Name of the event.
`true` if the event was handled; otherwise `false`.
the postback data is invalid.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains any commands.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> has one or more commands; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> contains a default command; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a list item can display all fields of an item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.HasItemDetails%2A> method indicates that the item needs a details view in order for the user to see all the data.
`true` if all fields of a list item can be displayed; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control contains a default command and no other commands.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> has a default command and no other commands; otherwise, `false`.
Called prior to rendering the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Renders the control on the page using the provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref> used to render the server control content on the client's browser.
Renders the details of the specified item.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.RenderItemDetails%2A> method is called during rendering for the details view of the specific item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> control.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem"></xref>.
Renders the list of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.RenderItemsList%2A> method is called during rendering to render each item in the list.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the list should jump to the first item beyond the currently visible items.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.ShowMore> field, which is the value "__more", is used by mobile control developers.
A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate that the browser should jump to a specific item in the list.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.ShowMoreFormat> field, which is an internal field and has the value "__more*n*", where `n` is a number, is created during rendering.

This field is used like the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.ShowMore> field, except that it specifies the index of the item to display in details view.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlObjectListAdapter.ShowMoreFormat> field is used by mobile control developers.
